Operation 'CreateAlert' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is too generic and lacks critical context. AI agents need to understand: what types of alerts can be created, what parameters are required, what the response contains, and when notifications will start. Added domain-specific details about alert types and frequency options from API context.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to create a new alert.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new email alert for your SendGrid account. Specify the alert type (e.g., statistics, usage), recipient email address, and frequency (as needed, hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly). Returns the created alert object with a unique alert_id. The alert will begin sending notifications according to the specified frequency.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and lacks critical context. AI agents need to understand: what types of alerts can be created, what parameters are required, what the response contains, and when notifications will start. Added domain-specific details about alert types and frequency options from API context.

message: Operation 'ListAlert' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description lacks specificity about response structure and use cases. AI agents need to know what data is returned to determine if this operation matches their intent. Added details about response format and practical use cases.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your alerts.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all email alerts configured for your SendGrid account. Returns an array of alert objects, each containing the alert_id, type, recipient email address, and frequency setting. Use this to view your current alert configuration and manage existing alerts.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about response structure and use cases. AI agents need to know what data is returned to determine if this operation matches their intent. Added details about response format and practical use cases.

message: Operation 'GetAlert' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is too minimal. AI agents need to understand the required input (alert_id), what data is returned, and practical use cases. Added specificity about response content and when this operation would be useful.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific alert.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the details of a specific alert by its alert_id. Returns the alert object containing the alert type, recipient email address, frequency setting, and other configuration details. Use this to view the current settings of an individual alert before updating or deleting it.
data.reasoning: Original description is too minimal. AI agents need to understand the required input (alert_id), what data is returned, and practical use cases. Added specificity about response content and when this operation would be useful.

message: Operation 'DeleteAlert' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description lacks critical information about side effects and requirements. AI agents need to know: what parameter is required, what happens after deletion (no more notifications), and that the action is permanent. Added these details for clarity and to prevent unintended deletions.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to delete an alert.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a specific alert by its alert_id, permanently removing it from your SendGrid account. No further notifications will be sent for this alert. Requires the alert_id as a path parameter. This action cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks critical information about side effects and requirements. AI agents need to know: what parameter is required, what happens after deletion (no more notifications), and that the action is permanent. Added these details for clarity and to prevent unintended deletions.

message: Operation 'UpdateAlert' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is too vague and lacks essential details. AI agents need to know: what can be updated, whether partial updates are supported, what the response contains, and when changes take effect. Added specificity about updateable fields, partial update support, and immediate effect of changes.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to update an alert.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing alert's configuration by its alert_id. Supports partial updates - you can modify the recipient email address, frequency setting (as needed, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly), or alert type. Returns the updated alert object with all current settings. Changes take effect immediately for future notifications.
data.reasoning: Original description is too vague and lacks essential details. AI agents need to know: what can be updated, whether partial updates are supported, what the response contains, and when changes take effect. Added specificity about updateable fields, partial update support, and immediate effect of changes.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to create a new alert.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new email alert for your SendGrid account. Specify the alert type (e.g., statistics, usage), recipient email address, and frequency (as needed, hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly). Returns the created alert object with a unique alert_id. The alert will begin sending notifications according to the specified frequency.
data.reasoning: Original description is too generic and lacks critical context. AI agents need to understand: what types of alerts can be created, what parameters are required, what the response contains, and when notifications will start. Added domain-specific details about alert types and frequency options from API context.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your alerts.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all email alerts configured for your SendGrid account. Returns an array of alert objects, each containing the alert_id, type, recipient email address, and frequency setting. Use this to view your current alert configuration and manage existing alerts.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about response structure and use cases. AI agents need to know what data is returned to determine if this operation matches their intent. Added details about response format and practical use cases.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific alert.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the details of a specific alert by its alert_id. Returns the alert object containing the alert type, recipient email address, frequency setting, and other configuration details. Use this to view the current settings of an individual alert before updating or deleting it.
data.reasoning: Original description is too minimal. AI agents need to understand the required input (alert_id), what data is returned, and practical use cases. Added specificity about response content and when this operation would be useful.

data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to delete an alert.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a specific alert by its alert_id, permanently removing it from your SendGrid account. No further notifications will be sent for this alert. Requires the alert_id as a path parameter. This action cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks critical information about side effects and requirements. data.current_description: This endpoint allows you to update an alert.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing alert's configuration by its alert_id. Supports partial updates - you can modify the recipient email address, frequency setting (as needed, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly), or alert type. Returns the updated alert object with all current settings. Changes take effect immediately for future notifications.
